Posts.Content: fancyfree77 wrote: I am 36 years old with a lump in my left breast that the doctor thinks is too hard and wants to remove it. I had a Mamo 2 days ago on my left breast but I don't have any results yet. My surgery is scheduled for next Friday the 13th for lump removal and biopsy. I want to be able to tell my doctor that if he gets in there and sees anything suspicious to take the whole breast. Should I tell him to take the other one as well? Are the chances greater of getting breast cancer in the other breast? I'm hoping everything will be fine, but I have three kids so I also think about worst case scenario too. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New and playing the waiting game!! fancyfree77 somethingnew

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2013 12:18PM fancyfree77 wrote: Received my Mamo results today: Your recent mammography examination showed an area that was not well characterized on the films that were obtained. In order to determine if this is a benign lesion, it will be necessary to get an ultrasound. I had an ultrasound done about a month ago which was inconclusive, and also prompted me to have this mamo done. These tests were done at different hospitals.
Posts.Title: New and playing the waiting game!! fancyfree77 somethingnew

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2013 01:11PM fancyfree77 wrote: It's a general surgeon doing the lump removal. I know that I will have a follow-up in his office 10 days after surgery, but I'm not sure I can wait that long. Will the surgeon be able to tell me anything after the surgery? I really hate the waiting game, I have never been good at it.
Posts.Title: New and playing the waiting game!! fancyfree77 somethingnew

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2013 03:36PM fancyfree77 wrote: I called the surgeon's office and the nurse said that she will talk to the doctor on Monday but since I just had an ultrasound done then another is probably not needed. I have surgery scheduled for next Friday (13th) for lump removal and biopsy. The waiting game sucks!!

Posts.Title: Received my Mamo results today fancyfree77 fancyfree77

Posts.Content: fancyfree77 wrote: I had my excisional biopsy done on 12/13/13 and the results came back b9.  I went for my follow-up 10 days after my surgery and the surgeon was surprised at how bruised I was.  I have another follow-up on Monday, but I'm still very bruised and I have a lot of pain in my breast when it is touched or bumped.
